title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.4. EMERGENCY RESPONSE HEALTH

description.narrative: By end 2021, DGAS, DGSELM, DSR, DS and health sector partners, including NGOs, in targeted zones have the capacity to prepare for and respond to health emergencies, which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health And Emergencies, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Polio Eradication, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1. By the end of 2022, adolescents, pregnant and lactating women, mothers and children 0-5 years of age are using more quality health services in the 10 targeted provinces.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, DGAS, DGSELM, DSR, DS and health sector partners, including NGOs, in targeted zones have the capacity to prepare forand respond to health emergencies

description.narrative: Preventable diseases, especially measles and cVDPV2, were under control, and the COVID-19 impact on health services reduced. The support provided for epidemic response, in particular against the COVID-19 pandemic, ensured the availability of vaccine and the vaccination of 240,864 persons, of whom 95,267 (0.55% of the population, or 1.1% of the target) are fully vaccinated. Storage capacity was assessed, and ultra-cold chain equipment evaluated and repaired for the storage of Pfizer vaccine. In addition, 1,822 healthcare providers were trained in case detection, including laboratory testing, referral and appropriate management of COVID-19 cases. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022
